results.definition: to a greater degree or extent; used with comparisons
examples: an even (or still) more interesting problem
still another problem must be solved

results.definition: (of a body of water) free from disturbance by heavy waves
examples: scarcely a ripple on the still water

results.definition: despite anything to the contrary (usually preceding a concession)
examples: granted that it is dangerous, all the same I still want to go

results.definition: lessen the intensity of or calm
a plant and works where alcoholic drinks are made by distillation
cause to be quiet or not talk
without moving or making a sound
examples: he sat still as a statue
they waited stock-still outside the door
he couldn't hold still any longer

results.definition: an apparatus used for the distillation of liquids; consists of a vessel in which a substance is vaporized by heat and a condenser where the vapor is condensed
a static photograph (especially one taken from a movie and used for advertising purposes)
examples: he wanted some stills for a magazine ad

results.definition: with reference to action or condition; without change, interruption, or cessation
examples: will you still love me when we're old and grey?

results.definition: used of pictures; of a single or static photograph not presented so as to create the illusion of motion; or representing objects not capable of motion
